articles.title: AI stirs up the recipe for concrete in MIT study
articles.description: With demand for cement alternatives rising, an MIT team uses machine learning to hunt for new ingredients across the scientific literature.
articles.author: Andrew Paul Laurent | MIT Concrete Sustainability Hub

articles.title: Teaching AI models what they don’t know
articles.description: A team of MIT researchers founded Themis AI to quantify AI model uncertainty and address knowledge gaps.
articles.author: Zach Winn | MIT News

articles.title: Teaching AI models the broad strokes to sketch more like humans do
articles.description: SketchAgent, a drawing system developed by MIT CSAIL researchers, sketches up concepts stroke-by-stroke, teaching language models to visually express concepts on their own and collaborate with humans.
articles.author: Alex Shipps | MIT CSAIL

articles.title: Building networks of data science talent
articles.description: Through collaborations with organizations like BREIT in Peru, the MIT Institute for Data, Systems, and Society is upskilling hundreds of learners around the world in data science and machine learning.
articles.author: Scott Murray | Institute for Data, Systems, and Society

articles.title: The sweet taste of a new idea
articles.description: Sendhil Mullainathan brings a lifetime of unique perspectives to research in behavioral economics and machine learning.
articles.author: Michaela Jarvis | MIT Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems

articles.title: An anomaly detection framework anyone can use
articles.description: PhD student Sarah Alnegheimish wants to make machine learning systems accessible.
articles.author: Barbra Gilley Williams | Center for Complex Engineering Systems

articles.title: Rationale engineering generates a compact new tool for gene therapy
articles.description: Researchers redesign a compact RNA-guided enzyme from bacteria, making it an efficient editor of human DNA.
articles.author: Jennifer Michalowski | McGovern Institute for Brain Research

articles.title: 3 Questions: How to help students recognize potential bias in their AI datasets
articles.description: Courses on developing AI models for health care need to focus more on identifying and addressing bias, says Leo Anthony Celi.
articles.author: Anne Trafton | MIT News

articles.title: Learning how to predict rare kinds of failures
articles.description: Researchers are developing algorithms to predict failures when automation meets the real world in areas like air traffic scheduling or autonomous vehicles.
articles.author: MIT Laboratory for Information and Decision Systems
